db:abstract.db:para: This type was introduced in Qt 5.8.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The MenuBar type provides a QML API for native platform menubars.
A menubar consists of a list of drop-down menus.
MenuBar is currently available on the following platforms:

db:listitem.db:para: Linux (only available on desktop environments that provide a global D-Bus menu bar)

db:para.db:emphasis: Types in Qt.labs modules are not guaranteed to remain compatible in future versions.

db:section.db:title: data : list<Object>
db:section.db:para: This default property holds the list of all objects declared as children of the menubar. The data property includes objects that are not Menu instances, such as Timer and QtObject.

db:section.db:title: menus : list<Menu>
db:section.db:para: This property holds the list of menus in the menubar.

db:section.db:title: window : Window
db:section.db:para: This property holds the menubar's window.
Unless explicitly set, the window is automatically resolved by iterating the QML parent objects until a Window or an Item that has a window is found.

db:section.db:title: void addMenu(Menu menu)
db:section.db:para: Adds a menu to end of the menubar.

db:section.db:title: void clear()
db:section.db:para: Removes all menus from the menubar.

db:section.db:title: void insertMenu(int index, Menu menu)
db:section.db:para: Inserts a menu at the specified index in the menubar.

db:section.db:title: void removeMenu(Menu menu)
db:section.db:para: Removes a menu from the menubar.
